Info.Name: Color Space
Info.Description: Color gamut for rendering images or text. Common color gamuts are: DeviceRGB (red, green, and blue), DeviceGray (grayscale, black and white), DeviceCMYK (cyan, purple, yellow, and black) color printing) and Indexed (colors indexed from the specified color table, no more than 256 colors)

Info.Name: Compression method
Info.Description: The method of compressing stream data

Info.Name: Procedure Set
Info.Description: Procedure Set used in the page or annotation, common procedures are: PDF, Text (text), ImageB (black and white image) and ImageC (color image)

Info.Name: Resource Object
Info.Description: Images, fonts and other binary resources used in pages, annotations, etc.

Info.Name: External Object
Info.Description: Represents objects used in rendering page directives. Because these objects are defined outside of page directives, they are called

Info.Name: External object type
Info.Description: Image means image

Info.Name: Original height of the image
Info.Description: Unit: Pixel

Info.Name: Original width of the image
Info.Description: Unit: Pixel

Info.Name: Pixel Component Bits
Mask
Info.Description: The mask image must be a two-color image. Normally, the mask image cannot be selected in the reader.

Info.Name: Interpolation
Info.Description: Whether to use interpolation algorithm to display the image

Info.Name: Compression Mode
Info.Description: Algorithms used to compress images, common algorithms are: DCTDecode (JPEG compression), FlateDecode (equivalent to PNG compression), CCITTFaxDecode or JBIG2Decode (efficient two-color image compression algorithm), JPXDecode (JPEG2000 compression)

Info.Name: Form
Info.Description: In addition to filling in data, the form can also be regarded as an embedded PDF page

Info.Name: External object type
Info.Description: Form means form

Info.Name: font type
Encoding
Info.Description: The encoding used by the font

Info.Name: Base Encoding
Info.Description: The base encoding method used by the font

Info.Name: Encoding Differences
Info.Description: The difference between the encoding used by the font and the base encoding (does not apply to True Type fonts)

Info.Name: font width table first character number
Font width table
Info.Description: The array representing the width of each character in the range from FirstChar to LastChar, the value of each character divided by 1000 is the unit width

Info.Name: Maximum Baseline Height
Info.Description: The maximum distance from the top of each character above the font baseline

Info.Name: Maximum Baseline Depth
Info.Description: The maximum distance from the bottom of each character to below the font baseline, this value should be negative

Info.Name: Font Family
Info.Description: Font name without style name, for example Times Bold Italic (Times Bold Italic) font family name is Times

Info.Name: Word Weight
Info.Description: Font Weight

Info.Name: Italic Angle
Info.Description: Anticlockwise inclination of the font

Info.Name: Embedded Font
Info.Description: Embedded Type 0 Font

Info.Name: Embedded Font
Info.Description: Embedded True Type Font

Info.Name: Embedded Font
Info.Description: Embedded font of type specified by subclass

Info.Name: Length of decompressed stream
Info.Description: Number of bytes after decompressing embedded font

Info.Name: Unicode mapping table
Info.Description: The conversion mapping table from the character identification value of the embedded font to the Unicode value

Info.Name: CharProcs
Info.Description: A dictionary containing font symbols and content streams used to draw the font instruction set

Info.Name: font matrix
Info.Description: Transformation matrix for converting font symbol coordinate system to text coordinate system

Info.Name: Resources
Info.Description: Font or image resources used by Type 3 fonts

Info.Name: default character width
Info.Description: default is 1000

Info.Name: glyph width list
Info.Description: The array representing the character width of the CID font (the value of each character divided by 1000 is the unit width) The default width value is specified by the DW value The character width of the array has Two formats: ①Single character width; ②Starting and ending character width The single character width format is: character index followed by an array, For example,

Info.Name: default character width and height
Info.Description: default is [880 -1000]

Info.Name: Character ID to font character ID mapping table
Info.Description: By default, the character ID is the position of the character in the font

Info.Name: The parent node of the document structure
Document Pages Collection
Info.Description: All Pages of Document

Info.Name: Style
Info.Description: 1: Italic; 2: Bold; 3: Bold Italic

Info.Name: Number of sub-bookmarks
Info.Description: Number of sub-bookmarks at the current level. Positive number: bookmarks are opened by default, negative numbers: bookmarks are collapsed by default

Info.Name: Metadata Information
Info.Description: Generally XML

Info.Name: page number label numerical numbering method
Named Location
Info.Description: The location where the document is named with a specific name (can be used as a bookmark, page link jump target)

Info.Name: Open Action
Info.Description: The action to be performed automatically when the document is opened

Info.Name: Extra Action
Info.Description: Action triggered by event

Info.Name: Document Token
Info.Description: Two binary data tokens used to identify the document, encrypted documents must have this token

Info.Name: Number of items
Info.Description: Number of items in the PDF document item index table

Info.Name: Document Pages Collection
Info.Description: All Pages of Document

Info.Name: Page content
Info.Description: Instructions to draw the page. For details, see the

Info.Name: Content border
Info.Description: Consists of four coordinate values ​​of left, bottom, right and top

Info.Name: Bleeding Border
Info.Description: Consists of four coordinate values ​​of left, bottom, right and top

Info.Name: Crop Box
Info.Description: Indicates the visible area after intercepting the page border, which consists of four coordinate values: left, bottom, right, and top. The intercepted border area should not exceed the area limited by the page border. To reduce the display or printing area of ​​the document, you can adjust this Border value. To expand the display or print area, you may need to adjust both this border and the page border.

Info.Name: Page Border
Info.Description: Indicates the area where the document is drawn, which consists of four coordinate values: left, bottom, right, and top (PDF uses the Cartesian coordinate system, that is, the coordinate of the lower left corner of the page is (0,0)). The page must be specified by the MediaBox item page border.

Info.Name: Trim Box
Info.Description: Consists of four coordinate values ​​of left, bottom, right and top

Info.Name: The page the annotation belongs to
Annotation name
Info.Description: The identifier that uniquely identifies this annotation within the same page

Info.Name: Annotation border
Info.Description: Parameters: horizontal corner radius, vertical corner radius, line width, and an optional line style array

Info.Name: User space unit
Info.Description: Value in multiples of 1/72 inch (default is 1)

Info.Name: Rotation Angle
Info.Description: The clockwise rotation angle of the page when browsing or printing, which must be an integer multiple of 90 or 0

Info.Name: Extra Action
Info.Description: The action triggered when the page is opened or closed

Info.Name: Page Drawing Instructions
Info.Description: The content of this node is a set of instructions for drawing pages. This node is a virtual node, generated by interpreting the content of the Contents node.

Transpose matrix ([a1,a2,0; b1,b2,0; c1,c2,1]) used to stretch, rotate and translate content. Set before transpose The coordinates are (x,y), then the transposed coordinates are: x' = a1 × x + b1 × y + c1; y' = a2 × x + b2 × y + c2. The effect of the transposed matrix is ​​cumulative, and the latter transposed matrix must first be multiplied by the matrix that appears before it is the final matrix value. The transposed matrix will affect subsequent drawing and text rendering results.

Draw the specified resource object (see the XObject item of Resources). Common resource objects include images (Image) and forms (Form). Regardless of the original object The size of the object, its width and height are compressed to 1 unit before processing. The actual rendering size of the object is determined by the previous transpose matrix (for example: the current transpose matrix is ​​[ 500 0 0 700 0 0], the width and height of the rendered object will be 500×700).

Specifies the drawing state area, which is actually a pair of instructions (q and Q). The drawing state includes states such as transposed matrix, color, color gamut, text, mask, etc.&# xD; When entering the drawing state (q), push the previous drawing state onto the stack, and then create a new drawing state. When leaving the drawing state (Q), put the previous drawing state on the stack. The drawing state is popped off the stack, that is, the original drawing state is restored.
Use the corresponding ExtGState parameter in Resources to set the drawing state
Use the corresponding ColorSpace parameter in Resources to set the non-linear (Nonstroking) color gamut
Use the corresponding ColorSpace parameter in Resources to set the Stroking color gamut
Set Nonstroking Color. Available parameters are determined by the previous Nonstroking (cs) operator.
Set the color of the stroking. Available parameters are determined by the previous stroking gamut (CS) operator.
Set non-linear (Nonstroking) red, green, and blue three-component color
Set the red, green and blue color of the line drawing (Stroking)
Set non-line (Nonstroking) cyan, red, yellow, and black four-component colors
Set the four-component color of cyan, red, yellow and black for stroking
Set non-line (Nonstroking) gray color
Set the gray color of Stroking

Specifies the text area, which is actually a pair of instructions (BT and ET). When entering the text area (BT), the text transpose matrix will be reset. Leaving the text area (ET) ), the text transpose matrix is ​​discarded.
Output newlines and strings. Single quote operator (') outputs newlines and text; double quote operator (") specifies word spacing, Kerning, then output line breaks and text.

Output string. Tj operator outputs text; TJ operator outputs text with extra character spacing. TJ operator The argument of the character is an array, the value of the string type specifies the text, and the value of the numeric type divided by -1000 specifies the offset of the subsequent text unit.

The transpose matrix ([a1,a2,0; b1,b2,0; c1,c2,1]) used to stretch, rotate and translate the text content. set the transpose The former coordinates are (x,y), then the transposed coordinates are: x' = a1 × x + b1 × y + c1; y' = a2 × x + b2 × y + c2. The effect of the text transpose matrix is ​​not cumulative, and the latter text transpose matrix replaces the former matrix. When positioning text, you also need to consider the effect of the newline operator. Set the horizontal starting position.

Set the starting position and offset the newline. The Td operator uses its horizontal and vertical offset parameters to wrap the line; the TD operator uses its horizontal and vertical offset parameters to wrap the line; , The offset parameters in both vertical directions will wrap, and the vertical offset parameter will be set to line spacing (TL) while wrapping; the T* operator will use the current line spacing to wrap, without changing the horizontal offset
Specify the font corresponding to Resources and set the font unit size. Multiply the font unit size with the text transposition matrix to determine the size of the font rendered.
Sets the percentage of text horizontal stretch (default is 100). This parameter also affects word spacing and kerning spacing.

Set the spacing between words (calculated by the text unit size that is not stretched by the text transposition matrix, the initial value is 0). The word spacing is actually the width of a half-width space (Unicode is 32) characters. If horizontal Stretching, word spacing multiplied by the horizontal stretch percentage is the actual distance.

Set the word spacing (calculated by the text unit size that is not stretched by the text transposition matrix, the initial value is 0). If horizontal stretching is set, kerning and horizontal stretching Multiplying is the actual distance.
Set the spacing between lines used by the newline operator (calculated in units of text not stretched by the text transpose matrix, the initial value is 0)

Sets the vertical offset distance of the text from the baseline. In general, positive numbers move up, negative numbers move down (calculated by the unit size of the text that is not stretched by the text transposition matrix, The initial value is 0).
Set the vector line end style. Available styles are: 0: wireless end; 1: rounded end; 2: square end.
Set the style of the connection position of vector lines. Available styles are: 0: sharp corner connection; 1: rounded corner connection; 2: square corner connection.
Set the dotted line pattern of the vector line
Set the vector line to start from the specified point
Set the vector line to end at the current point and connect the start point and end point
Draw a line from the previous vector point to the specified point

Draw the Cubic Bézier curve from the previous vector point to the specified point (x3, y3). There are 6 parameters in total, which are the head and tail control points (x1, y1), (x2, y2) and the end point (x3, y3)
Draw a Cubic Bézier curve from the previous vector point to the specified point (x3, y3). There are 4 parameters, which are the line tail control point (x2, y2) and the end point (x3, y3). )
Draw a Cubic Bézier curve from the previous vector point to the specified point (x3, y3). There are 4 parameters, which are the line head control point (x1, y1) and the end point (x3, y3)
Draw rectangle with specified width and height at given (x,y) point
Draw a line with the previously specified stroking color, line head, line tail, connecting line style, dotted line, etc.
Set the current point as the end point and draw a line with the Stroking color
Fills closed curves with a nonzero (Nonzero winding number) rule
Use even-odd rules to fill closed curves
Draw a line and fill the closed curve with a non-zero (Nonzero winding number) rule
Draw lines and fill closed curves with even-odd rules
Close the curve, draw a line, and fill the closed curve with a non-zero (Nonzero winding number) rule

Info.Token: Closed odd-odd line drawing and filling
Info.Description: Close the curve, draw a line, and fill the closed curve with the Even-odd rule
Closed vector path, without filling, without drawing lines, generally used to complete the clipping path
Use a nonzero (Nonzero winding number) rule to clip the content to a vector graphic composed of closed curves
Use the Even-odd rule to crop the content with a vector graphic composed of closed curves
The image embedded in the content stream is actually three instructions: BI (image start), ID (image binary data) and EI (end of image)
